# Issue Tracking & Ticketing {#sec-issue-tracking}

## Purpose

Every issue, deviation, or improvement opportunity must be captured in a ticket. Our ticketing system is the **single source of truth** for what happened, what's being done about it, and what was learned.

## Why Track Issues?

- **Nothing falls through the cracks** â€” Every issue gets attention
- **Accountability** â€” Every ticket has an owner
- **Transparency** â€” Anyone can see the status of any issue
- **Trends** â€” We can spot patterns and systemic problems
- **Audit trail** â€” Full history of actions taken
- **Learning** â€” Issues become training material

::: {.callout-tip}
## Rule of Thumb
**When in doubt, create a ticket.** It's always better to have a ticket that gets closed quickly than to have an issue that goes untracked.
:::

## Ticket Structure

Every ticket must include:

### Required Fields

| Field | Description | Example |
|-------|------------|---------|
| **Title** | Clear, concise summary | "Server SRV03 â€” alignment issue during rack installation" |
| **Type** | Category of the issue | Incident / Defect / Improvement / Question |
| **Priority** | Urgency level | Critical / High / Medium / Low |
| **Reporter** | Who found the issue | Team member name |
| **Assignee** | Who is responsible for resolution | Team member or Team Lead |
| **Date/Time** | When the issue was found | 2026-02-20 10:30 AM |
| **Location** | Where the issue occurred | Rack A, 15U-16U |
| **Server ID** | Which server (if applicable) | SRV03 / Serial: HP-DL385-xxxxx |
| **Description** | Detailed description | What happened, what was expected, what actually happened |
| **Evidence** | Supporting materials | Photos, logs, checklist copies |

: Required Ticket Fields {.striped}

## Ticket Lifecycle

```{mermaid}
%%| label: fig-ticket-lifecycle
%%| fig-cap: "Ticket Lifecycle"
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Open: Ticket Created
    Open --> InProgress: Assigned & Work Started
    InProgress --> UnderReview: Fix/Action Completed
    UnderReview --> Resolved: Verified by Checker
    UnderReview --> InProgress: Checker Rejected
    Resolved --> Closed: No Further Action
    Resolved --> RCATriggered: Needs RCA
    RCATriggered --> Closed: RCA Complete & CAPA Done

    Open --> Duplicate: Already Reported
    Open --> WontFix: Accepted Risk
```

### Status Definitions

| Status | Meaning | Who Updates |
|--------|---------|------------|
| **Open** | Issue reported, not yet started | Reporter |
| **In Progress** | Being worked on | Assignee |
| **Under Review** | Work done, needs verification | Assignee |
| **Resolved** | Verified and fixed | Checker / Team Lead |
| **RCA Triggered** | Needs root cause analysis | Team Lead |
| **Closed** | Fully complete, all actions done | Team Lead |
| **Duplicate** | Same as an existing ticket | Anyone |
| **Won't Fix** | Accepted risk, documented reason | Team Lead |

: Ticket Status Definitions {.striped}

## Priority Definitions & SLAs

| Priority | Definition | Response Time | Resolution Time |
|----------|-----------|---------------|-----------------|
| **Critical** | Safety hazard or infrastructure at risk | Immediate | 4 hours |
| **High** | Blocking installation or operation | 1 hour | 24 hours |
| **Medium** | Needs attention, not blocking | 4 hours | 72 hours |
| **Low** | Minor issue or improvement idea | Next standup | 1 week |

: Priority SLAs {.striped}

## Ticket Management Best Practices

### For Reporters

1. **Create tickets immediately** â€” don't wait until end of day
2. **Be specific** â€” "Server damaged" is not enough; describe the damage
3. **Attach photos** â€” A picture is worth a thousand words
4. **Use the template** â€” It ensures you don't forget important details
5. **Follow up** â€” Check your tickets regularly

### For Assignees

1. **Acknowledge quickly** â€” Move to "In Progress" when you start
2. **Update regularly** â€” Add comments as you work on it
3. **Don't close silently** â€” Add a resolution comment before closing
4. **Link related tickets** â€” If issues are connected, link them
5. **Trigger RCA if needed** â€” Don't wait to be told

### For Team Lead

1. **Review all new tickets daily** â€” During or before standup
2. **Ensure proper prioritization** â€” Adjust if needed
3. **Track SLAs** â€” Are we responding and resolving on time?
4. **Spot trends** â€” Are the same types of issues recurring?
5. **Close the loop** â€” Ensure RCA actions are completed
